availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William W. Gentry (Webster Co. JP & Farmer)

body.p: Farmer and Justice of the Peace in Webster County, Kentucky. North Carolina native. Married to Martha Gentry. Father of James A. Gentry, Moses J. Gentry, William H. Gentry, Yancy W. Gentry, Elean Gentry, Albert J. Gentry, John W. Gentry, and Martha D. Gentry. Master Freemason at Carlow Lodge, No. 314 in Webster County. Farmer in Person County, North Carolina, in 1850. Farmer in Webster County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, North Carolina, Person County County, stamped p. 475. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 138.
Proceedings of the Grand Lodge of Kentucky, at a Grand Annual Communication, in the City of Louisville, (Frankfort, Ky.: Frankfort Commonwealth, Printer, 1867), p. 323. Find A Grave, "William W. Gentry (1818-1878)," Memorial #74824870, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=gentry&GSfn=W&GSmn=W&GSby=1818&GSbyrel=in&GSdyrel=all&GSst=19&GScntry=4&GSob=n&GRid=74824870&df=all& (accessed August, 18, 2017).
